section.para: Represents a form (ypically: a word) which is the etymological origin of the entry or another etymologically related form

listitem.para: id to allow etymons to be members of relations
text (non-empty string, required) the etymological form
type (non-empty string, optional) the type of the etymology. Typical values include derivation, cognate or borrowing. Values can be specified using tag objects.
language (string, required) the language of the origin form. Values for languages should be specified with a EtymonLanguage mapping.
note (non-empty string, optional) extra information about the language, for example the precise time (e.g., 16th century) or geographical variants
reconstructed (boolean, optional) indicates that the form is reconstructed and not attested in any corpus
gramLabel (string, optional) a label that indicates the grammatical category of the etymon. Values can be specified using tag objects.
href (url, optional) a reference to a source for this etymology in an external resource

listingOrder (non-negative integer) If this etymon is part of a multietymon (a child of MultiEtymon) this indicates the order of this etymon. If this etymon is not part of a multietymon, then indicates its position among other etymons amd multietymons in the entry. This value may be implicit in some serializations.
